message: remove dead subscriber early fix bug dead subscriber would removed right away would consume resource file descriptor could lead bspwm process running available file descriptor able accept new incoming connection process subscribes bspwm event i.e bspc subscribe event bspwm keep state subscriber file descriptor write event event requested subscriber subscriber i.e bspc subscribe ... process killed bspwm doe know right away instead next event logged bspwm encounter error trying write file descriptor associated subscriber bspwm consider subscriber dead remove linked list also close file descriptor subscriber done put_status function defined subscribe.c mean bspwm keep file descriptor potentially closed stream time normally event generated often focusing node switching desktop etc ... therefore dead file descriptor kept around long however period inactivity i.e user actively using computer never switching node desktop file descriptor kept long time especially problematic following scenario user leaf machine idle churn subscriber happens subscriber come since machine idle event happening file descriptor dead subscriber closed bspwm consumes file descriptor new subscriber created point bspwm many opened file descriptor accepts new incoming connection accept syscall mainloop fails returning emfile bspwm stuck infinite loop able serve new request point bspwm need killed restarted could deemed unlikely maximum number opened file 1024 afaik arch linux turn exact scenario happen polybar http github.com polybar polybar bspwm module laptop connected external monitor becomes idle screen saver kick polybar periodically reloads xrandr event therefore periodically kill create subscriber since activity bspwm process dead instance polybar subscriber removed bspwm eventually run file descriptor get stuck infinite loop consuming 100 cpu note polybar issue polybar doe right thing fix follows main loop bspwm check dead subscriber remove accomplished new function declared subscribe.h iterate linked list subscriber try call write file descriptor empty buffer i.e size write fails return subscriber declared dead function remove list close associated file descriptor
